actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4051.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4051 — "To direct the Secretary of Commerce to establish a task force regarding shark depredation, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Westerman objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3415.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3415 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey to the Midvale Irrigation District the Pilot Butte Power Plant in the State of Wyoming, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2997.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2997 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Mesa County, Colorado, certain Federal land in Colorado, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Westerman objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1727.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1727 — "To amend the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal Development Act to extend the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park Commission."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2882.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2882 — "To reauthorize the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: United States-China Economic and Security Review Commission
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1238(b)(3) of the Floyd D. Spence National Defense Authorization Act of Fiscal Year 2001 (22 U.S.C. 7002), the Democratic Leader on behalf of the Speaker appointed Mr. Leland Miller of Alexandria, Virginia.

actions-list.header: United States-China Economic and Security Review Commission
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1238(b)(3) of the Floyd D. Spence National Defense Authorization Act of Fiscal Year 2001 (22 U.S.C. 7002), the Democratic Leader appointed Jonathan Nicholas Stivers of Falls Church, Virginia.

actions-list.header: Select Subcommittee on the Weaponization of the Federal Government
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1(a)(2)(A) of H. Res. 12, the second order of the House of February 1, 2023, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Select Subcommittee on the Weaponization of the Federal Government: Mr. Davidson and Mr. Fry.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 1, 2024, at 3:45 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.R. 1568.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignation of the gentleman from New York, Mr. Higgins, the whole number of the House is 431.
The Chair designated Mr. Rose to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jerry L. Carl to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
